Context:
The Electronics Technician program at the college offers modules in 2D and 3D animations, computer-based testing, CircuitLogix and 3DLab simulation software. Open enrolment is available with typical completion time of 32 weeks, but no time limits exist. Prerequisites include an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, or mature student status. An electronics background is helpful, but not essential.

Advanced standing allows those who have completed the Electromechanical Technician program to bypass 18 modules of the Electronics Technician program. Career opportunities include working as service technicians on electronic products and equipment for consumers, businesses, and industries with activities such as assembling, maintaining, testing, troubleshooting, repairing, and upgrading equipment and systems.

Credits from this program can be applied towards the Electronics Engineering Technician diploma program, a four-year Bachelor of Science in Technology Management degree offered through George Brown College’s partnership with Indiana State University (ISU), a four-year Bachelor of Science degree offered through George Brown College’s partnership with Athabasca University, or a four-year Bachelor of Science in Organizational Studies degree offered through George Brown College’s partnership with Neumann University.

The required courses for this program include: ELNC 9034 - Introduction to Electronics; ELCL 9049 - Current, Voltage and Resistance; ELCL 9050 - Ohm’s Law, Power and Energy; ELCL 9048 - Series Circuits; ELCL 9047 - Parallel Circuits; ELNC 9036 - DC Measuring Instruments; ELCL 9045 - Network Theorems; ELCL 9044 - Magnetism; ELCL 9043 - Magnetic Circuits; ELCL 9042 - Alternating Voltages and Currents; ELCL 9041 - AC Measuring Instruments; ELCL 9040 - Capacitance and Capacitors. The modules should be taken in the order listed.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Electronics Technician Program (Distance Education) T901 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Programs Offered:
- ELCL 9040: Capacitance and Capacitors
- ELCL 9039: Inductance and Inductors
- ELNC 9033: Transformers
- ELCL 9038: Alternating Current Circuits
- ELNC 9031: Coupling and Filter Circuits
- ELNC 9032: Resonance
- ELNC 9037: Transistors and Thyristors
- ELNC 9029: Amplifier Circuits
- ELNC 9028: Integrated Circuits
- ELNC 9035: Digital Electronics
- ELCL 9091: Microprocessors

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Students: $1,760.00* for the program starting in fall 2022
- International Students: No additional cost but charged same fees in US dollars

Financial Assistance:
- This program is not eligible for OSAP funding.

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- Grade 12 English (C or U)
- Grade 11 math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U)
- Mature student status (19 years of age or older)

Special Requirements:
- International Students: This online distance program is only available to study while remaining in their home country and does not qualify for study/work permit eligibility in Canada.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Electronics Technician Program (Distance Education) T901 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context: This online distance program is only available for students who are not in Canada and does not qualify for study/work permits in Canada. The minimum computer requirements include a Pentium-based PC or equivalent, 512MB RAM (1GB recommended), 250MB available hard disk space, Windows 7/8/8.1/10 operating system, an email account, and internet access. The program software only runs on Windows Operating Systems and is not compatible with Mac or Linux systems. International students can contact the college by calling 416-415-4726 or toll-free 1-888-553-5333, or emailing [info@gbctechtraining.com](mailto:info@gbctechtraining.com]. Related programs include Electromechanical Engineering Technician (T146), Electrical Techniques (T167), and Electromechanical Technician (Distance Education) (T902). Prospective students can visit the campus, sign up to receive application resources, and explore course details at etcourse.com.
